meanings.definition: Not taken upon oneself without permission or authority.
meanings.sent1: The unassumed responsibility was left unattended.
meanings.sent2: She wore an unassumed expression, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The unassumed cake in the fridge turned out to be a surprise for the party.
meanings.sent4: His unassumed power quietly influenced the outcome of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The unassumed presence of the cat startled the birds.

meanings.definition: Not taken for granted or presumed.
meanings.sent1: The unassumed success took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: He appreciated her unassumed kindness towards others.
meanings.sent3: The unassumed twist in the story kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: Her unassumed talent shone brightly during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The unassumed beauty of the garden amazed the visitors.

meanings.sent1: The unassumed treasure was hidden deep underground.
meanings.sent2: He kept his unassumed emotions bottled up inside.
meanings.sent3: The unassumed artwork was revealed only at the end of the exhibition.
meanings.sent4: Her unassumed skills became evident during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The unassumed entrance to the secret garden was camouflaged by vines.
